description.narrative: By 2017 Media, NGOs, business, children and adolescents participate in partnerships and alliances for monitoring, advocacy and promotion of child's rights, which contributes to Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, a national alliance for children (involving the government, international community, civil society, private sector and the media) mobilises support, capacity and resources to significantly advance the rights of Bulgarian children and youth.

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
HSS - public finance management for Health
Multisector aid for basic social services
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/04/002 ALLIANCES AND NATIONAL CAPACITY FOR CHIL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017 Media, NGOs, business, children and adolescents participate in partnerships and alliances for monitoring, advocacy and promotion of child’s rights

description.narrative: Strategic partnerships strengthened and new alliances built through advocacy and communication efforts that were focused on eliminating violence against children, early childhood development, inclusive education, children uprooted, and adolescence and engaged a wide variety of allies from Government, civil society, business, media, academia as well as children and adolescents. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of business entities that are promoting children's rights on the basis of the business principles initiative framework

target.value: 2017:20 business entities participate in the of the initiative by 2017

actual.value: 2016:The launch of the initiative postponed at global level.

title.narrative: # of alliances with civil society organisations for child rights advocacy

target.value: 2017:4 alliances with civil society organisations, including national networks, professional associations and specific-topic groups of NGOs

title.narrative: # of partnerships with media related to monitoring and advocacy of child rights

baseline.value: 4 major partnerships in the country in 2012

target.value: 2016:5 new media partnerships on national and local levels supporting and advocating for child rights established with UNICEF support by the end of 2017

actual.value: 2016:5 new media partnerships at national and local levels supporting and advocating for child rights established.

title.narrative: Number of articles and electronic media reports violating principles of ethical reporting on children, as per Agreement on Ethical Reporting on Children adopted in 2012

target.value: 2017:50% reduction in number of articles and electronic media reports by 2015

actual.value: 2016:Data not available. Research planned for end 2017.

title.narrative: Number of young people reached through communication tools

target.value: 2017:100,000 young people reached and 10,000 engaged by 2017

actual.value: 2016:50,000 young people reached and 10,000 engaged in 2016.
